hornfels.name: Hornfels
hornfels.description: A Hearthian astronomer studying star charts by the campfire.
hornfels.fallback_dialogue: Hornfels continues studying the star charts, occasionally making notes.

dialogues.teaches: Explore Timber Hearth to piece together the knowledge needed for space travel.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: Hey there, Hatchling! You're officially our youngest astronaut now. Welcome to the space program.

lines.speaker: player
lines.text: So what's my mission?

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: Same as everyone else. Explore the solar system, uncover what you can about the Nomai. They went extinct thousands of years ago, but their ruins are everywhere.

lines.speaker: player
lines.text: What are we hoping to find?

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: Whatever they knew. What they were looking for. And, uh, their unique analytical frameworks regarding epistemic agency. You know, the usual ancient alien civilization stuff.

lines.speaker: player
lines.text: That last part sounds oddly specific.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: Look, I didn't write the grant proposal. Just take your time, explore the village, check out the Observatory. When you're ready to launch, you'll know what you need.

dialogues.teaches: Examine the artifacts in the Observatory to learn what you need for space travel.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: Have you checked out the artifacts in the Observatory yet? They've got really useful stuff for your voyage.

lines.speaker: player
lines.text: I'll check them out.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: Good idea. Take your time with them. Even the unstable looking ones.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: Hey, you've been through all the exhibits! Everything we archived from the Nomai ruins.

lines.speaker: player
lines.text: Yeah, fascinating stuff. The way they thought about knowledge and agency.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: Exactly! That's the understanding you need. Your ship's launch code is EPISTEMIC. That'll get you off-world.

lines.speaker: player
lines.text: EPISTEMIC. Got it.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: Ready to head out into space? The solar system is waiting for you, Hatchling.

lines.speaker: player
lines.text: I'm excited to see what's out there.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: That's the spirit! Keep exploring. There's more out there than any of us realized.

esker.name: Esker
esker.description: A lone Hearthian explorer gazing at the quantum anomalies.
esker.fallback_dialogue: Esker watches the flickering Nomai texts with quiet fascination.

dialogues.teaches: Some knowledge requires special techniques to access. Look for hints in the environment.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: Hey there, Hatchling! Isn't this place incredible? Nomai ruins everywhere.

lines.speaker: player
lines.text: I've never seen inscriptions like these. They're flickering?

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: Quantum superposition! The texts exist in multiple states until you observe them right. There's a technique for it. I found instructions on one of the readable texts here.

lines.speaker: player
lines.text: I'll look for it.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: Once you learn it, all sorts of hidden knowledge opens up. It's like learning to see in a whole new way.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: You learned quantum observation! Nice work. There are flickering texts all over the solar system you can read now.

lines.speaker: player
lines.text: It's an incredible technique.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: Right? One discovery just leads to another.

dialogues.teaches: There's a mysterious quantum object in the solar system. Riebeck on Brittle Hollow might know more.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: I've been seeing something strange out there. Some kind of quantum presence that flickers in and out.

lines.speaker: player
lines.text: That's pretty convenient timing. What kind of presence?

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: Can't pin it down. Not on your signal scope, but I swear I've glimpsed it. Riebeck's investigating quantum stuff on Brittle Hollow. They might know more.

lines.speaker: player
lines.text: I'll check with Riebeck.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: Good idea. If anyone can figure out a quantum mystery, it's them. Just be careful. Quantum space is weird.

gabbro.name: Gabbro
gabbro.description: A laid-back Hearthian lounging by the radio equipment, surprisingly calm about the time loops.
gabbro.fallback_dialogue: Gabbro hums quietly, watching the signal frequencies dance across the displays.

dialogues.teaches: Visit the radio station to log frequencies for space navigation.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: Hey there. Just hanging out, listening to everyone's signals. It's pretty peaceful.

lines.speaker: player
lines.text: You seem really relaxed.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: Not a lot happens here. Good spot to just exist, you know? Oh, the frequencies you log stick with you. Handy for navigation. They persist even through the... well, you'll figure that part out.

lines.speaker: player
lines.text: Persist through what?

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: You'll know when it happens. Check the frequency log sometime. Shows you who's out there broadcasting.

lines.speaker: player
lines.text: Anything else I should know?

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: We've been picking up this weird quantum signal. Haven't pinned down the frequency yet. If you stumble across it, come back and we'll add it to the log.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: So you've noticed too. Yeah, time keeps resetting. Weird stuff.

lines.speaker: player
lines.text: How are you so calm about this?

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: What am I gonna do, panic? We keep our memories at least. Could be worse.

riebeck.name: Riebeck
riebeck.description: A nervous but curious Hearthian geologist studying the quantum phenomena on Brittle Hollow.
riebeck.fallback_dialogue: Riebeck adjusts their equipment nervously, occasionally glancing at the fractured planet.

dialogues.teaches: Riebeck studies quantum phenomena. Learn quantum observation to discuss their discoveries.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: Oh! Hey, Hatchling! I'm Riebeck. I'd say I'm a geologist, but I've been more of a reluctant quantum researcher I guess.

lines.speaker: player
lines.text: Quantum researcher? That sounds fascinating.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: Terrifying, more like. The Nomai left all this research about quantum superposition and hidden spaces, but I can't make sense of it. The texts flicker in and out, totally unstable. Also this planet is collapsing into a black hole which really doesn't help.

lines.speaker: player
lines.text: I might have seen something like it before...

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: Right! If you figure out how to observe them, come talk to me. I think there's something important I'm just not seeing.

dialogues.teaches: Riebeck found a quantum cavern past the tower on Brittle Hollow.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: Oh, you're here! Wait, you can see it too, right? The quantum instability?

lines.speaker: player
lines.text: I learned quantum observation. I can see flickering texts now.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: That's it! That's what I was missing! There's a quantum cavern near the tower. You should be able to find it now. I found Nomai texts there about a 'Quantum Moon.'

lines.speaker: player
lines.text: Quantum Moon? Where is it?

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: That's the mystery. I tried visiting but got completely lost. Kept walking in circles. Genuinely thought I was going to die there, which would've been embarrassing. The cavern has the frequency info. It's just past the tower.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: You found the Quantum Moon frequency? That's great! Just be careful on the surface. It's not like normal space.

lines.speaker: player
lines.text: What happened when you were there?

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: Every direction looped back on itself. Super disorienting. I think you need to understand the quantum environment to navigate it. Maybe there's a protocol somewhere?

dialogues.teaches: The quantum cavern is unstable and can fall into the black hole. Time your exploration carefully.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: Did you see that?! The quantum cavern justâ€”it broke away from the planet! Fell straight into the black hole!

lines.speaker: player
lines.text: I saw it. The whole chunk just... collapsed.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: This planet is so unstable. I've been tracking the structural decay patterns, and certain areas go first. The cavern was always precarious. If you need to get there, you'll have to move fast early in the... well, early.

lines.speaker: player
lines.text: How much time do I have?

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: Based on my calculations? Not much. Maybe 14, 15 actions at most before that section collapses. I know that's not a lot of time, but it's what we're working with on a disintegrating planet.

solanum.name: Solanum
solanum.description: A Nomai traveler who exists in quantum superposition, patient as starlight.
solanum.fallback_dialogue: Solanum watches the quantum trees shimmer with impossible light.

dialogues.teaches: You can talk to Solanum about different topics.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: Hello, Hearthian. I've been waiting here, watching the quantum states collapse and reform. It's peaceful.

lines.speaker: player
lines.text: You're Nomai? I thought your species was gone.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: We are gone, yes. But quantum entanglement allows certain persistences. I exist here at the Eye's sixth location. A quantum echo of who I was.

lines.speaker: player
lines.text: I have so many questions.

lines.speaker: npc
lines.text: And I have time. Ask me what you wish to understand.
